com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.sessions

Interface DocumentSessionProvider

  • All Superinterfaces:
    DocumentSessionEventHandler
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HostAppDocumentSessionProvider, HostAppDocumentSessionProvider, SingleDocumentSessionProvider

    public interface DocumentSessionProvider
extends DocumentSessionEventHandler
    The DocumentSessionProvider provides the DocumentSession for active application document. If you are developing an integration for a multiple document application you have to implement this interface and use GuiControllersFactory.createGuiControllerBuilder(com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.GuiCheckController, DocumentSessionProvider) .
    If you are writing an integration for a single document application you could use a SingleDocumentSessionProvider. In this case you also could use the shortcut GuiControllersFactory.createGuiControllerBuilder(com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.GuiCheckController, DocumentSession) .

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static DocumentSessionProvider NULL
      The NULL object for DocumentSessionProvider providing The DocumentSession.NULL.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.sessions.DocumentSessionEventHandler

    • Field Detail

      • NULL

        static final DocumentSessionProvider NULL
        The NULL object for DocumentSessionProvider providing The DocumentSession.NULL. It could be used for testing.

    • Method Detail

      • provideDocumentSession

        DocumentSession provideDocumentSession()
        Returns:
        The DocumentSession for the active document. For each document just one DocumentSession should exist. If no active document exists you should return DocumentSessionsFactory.NULL() via GuiFactory.documentSessions().
        Use DocumentSessionsFactory.create(DocumentSessionComponentFactory, Extractor, com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.checking.inline.markings.offset.OffsetEditorView) to create a new DocumentSession. See: DocumentSessionComponentFactory and Extractor
